programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Did you know a beavers teeth never stop growing and that it can use them to build dams big enough to see from outer space? A flock of Canada geese can migrate 1500 miles in a single day. Plus, the Bison can move 40 mph!

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: This show features some of the coolest creatures from the continent of Europe. Find out why the Mongoose is immune to cobra venom. And why 80% of the Dragonfly's brain is used to process what it sees.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Visit one of most magnificent places in the World with towering waterfalls and giant sequoias. Join Philippe Cousteau as we explore Yosemite National Park!

programme.title: Xploration: Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to Curacao and dives along the coral reefs to capture lionfish, an invasive species that's destroying the sea life in these waters. We visit the Chesapeake Bay to see what's being done to restore the oyster population.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Lifelong photographer and journalist Jefferson Graham shows off the most photographable places through the lens of his smartphone.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: It's been a year packed with unforgettable locations and photo moments. Jefferson Graham counts down his top photography tips from 2025's adventures - practical, creative hacks you can use anywhere to elevate your travel shots.

programme.title: World's Funniest Videos: Top 10 Countdown
programme.desc: Why pigs, dogs and parrots are the real party animals; popping champagne; why hair and fire don't mix.

programme.title: World's Funniest Videos: Top 10 Countdown

programme.title: World's Funniest Videos: Top 10 Countdown

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield

programme.title: Frontier Marshal
programme.desc: In the frontier town of Tombstone, Arizona, the charismatic Wyatt Earp (Randolph Scott) is a pistol-toting sheriff who earns the respect of almost everyone he encounters. John "Doc" Halliday (Cesar Romero), however, poses an unusual challenge to the lawman when he flouts local rules with his illegal business ventures. But the sheriff finds himself acting on Halliday's behalf when the latter is slain, leading to the famed gun battle at the O.K. Corral.

programme.title: Westbound
programme.desc: A former Union officer, John Hayes (Randolph Scott) now manages a stagecoach company. However, Clay Putnam (Andrew Duggan), a businessman still loyal to the South, is intent on robbing the coaches operated by Hayes, which transport gold to the North from California. Hoping to heist the treasure as a way to revive the Confederacy, Putnam also has a grudge against Hayes, since his wife, Norma (Virginia Mayo), was once involved with the handsome Union soldier.

programme.title: Sinbad: Where U Been
programme.desc: Sinbad hits the stage hard as he speaks truth to the burning subjects of the day, from poverty and politics to where he's been keeping himself.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Fatimah Taliah: Nice to Meet Me
programme.desc: From the stress of student loans to anxiety and getting to know herself on lockdown, here is comedian Fatimah Taliah’s breakout comedy special!

programme.title: Rob Schneider: Soy Sauce and the Holocaust
programme.desc: Rob Schneider takes on lessons about love and other cultures, and telling side-splitting stories of the three hoods: childhood, adulthood, and parenthood.

programme.title: Rita Rudner: A Tale of Two Dresses
programme.desc: The famed Vegas headliner returns, as witty, insightful,and cutting as ever, as she riffs on life as a sixty-something in today's America.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Reset
programme.desc: Notable standup comedian D.L. Hughley skewers current political events, his own family issues, and more in this hilarious standup special.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It
programme.desc: The excitable comic again proves why he is one of the world’s premiere funnymen, ripping into racial stereotypes, Viagra, the First Lady, and more.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin brings his blunt and undeniable style to this stand-up set about athletes and racial stereotypes, relationships, and human mistakes.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: And Laughter For All
programme.desc: Marriage and parenthood won't keep die-hard metalhead comedian Jim Breuer from losing his manic sense of humor in this hilarious live show.

programme.title: Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
programme.desc: The SNL alum, radio host, and film actor clears the air at his live event, chronicling his transformation from oddball child to ultimate family man.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Quality Time
programme.desc: The comedian discusses why we aren’t honest about not wanting to attend events, lying to children, and so much more in this hilarious special.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy star describes how his wife faced a medical crisis, and he attempted to hold down the fort for their five children.

programme.title: Erik Rivera: I'm No Expert
programme.desc: The charming and painfully honest comedian Erik Rivera’s stand-up comedy deals with relationships, fatherhood, and having strict immigrant parents.

programme.title: Arnez J.: Racially Motivated
programme.desc: Tackling everything from race relations to family life to hilarious impersonations, Arnez J is laugh-out-loud funny in his one-hour special.

programme.title: Bob Smiley: You're Just Hungry
programme.desc: The fast-talking comedian discusses touring with a Christian group, laughter being the best medicine, and having a last name TSA agents love.

programme.title: Bob Smiley: Tartar Terrorist
programme.desc: The clean comedian discusses his experiences in Arkansas, why he won’t make fun of the Clintons, and his weird moments at the airport.

programme.title: Chris Porter: Ugly & Angry
programme.desc: Last Coming Standing alum, Chris Porter, gives his look on drugs, growing old, women’s fashion, and his love for Taco Bell.

programme.title: Chris Porter: A Man From Kansas
programme.desc: Kansas-based comedian Chris Porter’s comedy set about men’s very limited emotions, people who think the Earth is flat, and hipsters ruining food.

programme.title: Colin Quinn: Unconstitutional
programme.desc: Comedian Colin Quinn analyzes the constitutional history of the United States.

programme.title: Gina Brillon: The Floor Is Lava
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses her childhood, the secrets that men have learned about dating apps, and life with her Midwestern husband.

programme.title: Jeff Garcia
programme.desc: Jeff Garcia aims to give audiences their money's worth with his signature original shows in this 2008 special.

programme.title: Jeff Garcia: Low Budget Madness
programme.desc: Shot live at San Manuel Indian Bingo and Casino in Highland, CA, Jeff Garcia's Low Budget Madness is packed with hilarious sketches that will leave you in stitches and remind you why audiences all over the world can't get a enough of Jeff Garcia!

programme.title: Jeff Garcia: Living the Dream
programme.desc: The Latino comedian and voiceover artist brings his signature style to jokes about family, cars, white people, marriage, and his run-ins with the law.

programme.title: Kim McVicar: Female Comedian
programme.desc: Canadian comedian Kim McVicar explains why your cell phone is more important to you than your kids, how Tik Tok ruined clubbing, and more.

programme.title: Kim McVicar: Tap Dancing on My Mother's Grave
programme.desc: The comedian and former backup dancer riffs about how bad she sucks in bed, advanced-age sex workers and, naturally, her mother’s practice funeral.

programme.title: Marc Maron: Thinky Pain
programme.desc: The hilarious podcaster and comedian takes stock of his own neuroses and self-loathing while providing brilliant insights on life.

programme.title: Nick Cannon: F--k Nick Cannon
programme.desc: A recent health scare has changed how he sees the world and he is here to share his unique perspective on getting older, raising his children, and living with his famous wife.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Wish Upon

programme.title: Megaboa

programme.title: Alligator II: The Mutation

programme.title: Phantasm: Remastered
programme.desc: The residents of a small town have begun dying under strange circumstances, leading young Mike (Michael Baldwin) to investigate. After discovering that the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm), the town's mortician, is killing and reanimating the dead as misshapen zombies, Mike seeks help from his older brother, Jody (Bill Thornbury), and local ice cream man Reggie (Reggie Bannister). Working together, they try to lure out and kill the Tall Man, all the while avoiding his minions and a deadly silver sphere.

programme.title: Phantasm III: Lord of the Dead
programme.desc: The evil alien known as the Tall Man (Angus Scrimm) has infiltrated the minds of Mike (A. Michael Baldwin) and Reggie (Reggie Bannister). The two friends embark on a journey to find and kill him, only to discover that he has destroyed town after town, leaving zombies in place of the living. Along the way, Mike and Reggie meet several characters who share their goal, including a murderous boy named Tim (Kevin Connors) and two young women who are excellent fighters.

programme.title: Phantasm IV: Oblivion
programme.desc: Mike escapes the Tall Man, who’d begun to transform him, leaving Reggie to hop dimensions until he finds the truth about the night his brother died.

programme.title: Phantasm: Ravager
programme.desc: The phantasm nightmare comes to an end as reality blurs for a hero in search of his friend and out to vanquish a villain who can be two places at once

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the days get shorter, it is a busy time in the garden. Monty Don cracks on with his seasonal tasks at Longmeadow, giving hints and tips along the way. Carol Klein visits first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for the very last time.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Living in the state of Kansas, Trent has had some tremendous success over the years. One of which has a very huge part of Trent's heart being it is his biggest buck to date! Mufasa was a 226" buck that was on his In-laws farm. That hunt and property obviously became very special to him. From that moment Trent dreamed of owning a property just like it to try and grow even more deer of this caliber on his own. After starting his career with Midwest Land group Trent was able to create enough income to purchase his first ever farm, which happened to be the exact farm he killed his biggest buck "Mufasa" on. Trent made the farm his own and was very excited to hunt it for the very first time as the land owner. In the very same stand he released his arrow in for Mufasa he kills on his first hunt of the year and connects with his top target buck! An insane full circle of events makes this story one that Trent will never forget.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!
Donnie Monroe bikes to a New Mexico bull, then chases big whitetails inKansas and Ohio!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: The Hunted Land & Sea is in Montana hunting for whitetail deer with Harris Hunts. Kristian Hansen and Gerry Holland have tags and Kim Hansen is tagging along for the hunt. Part Two.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Gerry Holland heads to North Dakota to hunt pheasant with his father in law Joe Myers, their extended family and bird dogs.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: From group sharing, to detailed wind forecasts, to the most accurate predictive model for whitetail movement, Will Cooper shares three big reasons you need the HuntStand app in deer camp.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are joined by Kirk Shebrine and his close friend Scott as they head back to the Cornhusker state to hunt turkeys. They've called in a ton of turkeys over the years but this time they're using a reaping decoy to try to get up close and personal with these Nebraskan long beards. This is a method that they've never tried before and with new methods, comes new challenges.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Denny McMahan on this episode at the legendary Thumbtack Ranch in South Texas. Denny was nominated by his wife for Bucks for the Brave program hosted by Trinity Oaks. After dedicating his life to service in the US Army and law enforcement, he now continues the mission by teaching at the police academy. Denny is a true hero in his community - someone who sacrifices his time, his well being, and his life in service to others, never asking for anything in return.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Anatomy Hunter Brian Johnson shares his meticulous research on deer anatomy and behavior, guiding Dan through the critical factors that determine the perfect shot placement.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel breaks down the key elements he uses to increase his odds in any duck hunt. From scouting to setup to safety, Cole has you covered.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Bill Hayes was at ground zero on September 11th, 2001. Now twenty years later, Bill recalls his time serving overseas in the military as well as a New York City Firefighter.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: What starts as a normal trip turns wild as Capt. Jared and Capt. Garrett get swarmed by Cobia.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: The sharks won’t stop Capt. Jared and special Guest Capt. Jimmy Hendricks from having their day.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Capt. Jake Leon hop in the bay boat in search of a back country slam.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Living in the state of Kansas, Trent has had some tremendous success over the years. One of which has a very huge part of Trent's heart being it is his biggest buck to date! Mufasa was a 226" buck that was on his In-laws farm. That hunt and property obviously became very special to him. From that moment Trent dreamed of owning a property just like it to try and grow even more deer of this caliber on his own. After starting his career with Midwest Land group Trent was able to create enough income to purchase his first ever farm, which happened to be the exact farm he killed his biggest buck "Mufasa" on. Trent made the farm his own and was very excited to hunt it for the very first time as the land owner. In the very same stand he released his arrow in for Mufasa he kills on his first hunt of the year and connects with his top target buck! An insane full circle of events makes this story one that Trent will never forget.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!
Donnie Monroe bikes to a New Mexico bull, then chases big whitetails inKansas and Ohio!

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: The Hunted Land & Sea is in Montana hunting for whitetail deer with Harris Hunts. Kristian Hansen and Gerry Holland have tags and Kim Hansen is tagging along for the hunt. Part Two.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Gerry Holland heads to North Dakota to hunt pheasant with his father in law Joe Myers, their extended family and bird dogs.

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: From group sharing, to detailed wind forecasts, to the most accurate predictive model for whitetail movement, Will Cooper shares three big reasons you need the HuntStand app in deer camp.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are joined by Kirk Shebrine and his close friend Scott as they head back to the Cornhusker state to hunt turkeys. They've called in a ton of turkeys over the years but this time they're using a reaping decoy to try to get up close and personal with these Nebraskan long beards. This is a method that they've never tried before and with new methods, comes new challenges.

programme.title: The Accidental Tourist
programme.desc: A travel writer hates to travel and loves order, until everything changes.

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: A talented, but temperamental and womanizing actor, who has antagonized every producer in NYC, needs money and plays the unlikely role of a lifetime.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager learns wisdom and self-control from an unorthodox karate master. With his new mentor's guidance, the boy faces down his fears.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II
programme.desc: After learning that his father is dying, karate master Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) returns home to Okinawa, bringing his protege, Daniel (Ralph Macchio), with him. In Japan, Miyagi is surprised to discover that his old sweetheart, Yukie (Nobu McCarthy), has remained single. Meanwhile, Daniel is attracted to Yukie's niece, Kumiko (Tamlyn Tomita). But romance must be put on hold while Daniel and Miyagi deal with local bullies and long-harbored grudges.

programme.title: The 6th Day
programme.desc: In the future, a corporation has begun illegally cloning humans. They mistakenly clone the wrong man, who is now the only one who could expose them.

programme.title: Air Force One
programme.desc: Harrison Ford portrays a Vietnam vet and U.S President whose Air Force One flight with the First Family is hijacked by a terrorist bent on revenge.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A big-hearted, working class teenager must overcome the odds in order to fulfill his dreams of playing football for Notre Dame.

programme.title: A Knight's Tale
programme.desc: A peasant poses as a knight and enters a medieval jousting tournament in order to escape his humble roots and win the heart of a noble lady.

programme.title: Running With Scissors
programme.desc: A teenage boy is "adopted" by his mother's wacky therapist and must cope with an extended family of eccentrics.

programme.title: All the Pretty Horses
programme.desc: The dreams of an American wanting to live the cowboy way in Mexico become a web of murder and betrayal when he falls for a powerful man’s daughter.

programme.title: Murphy's Romance
programme.desc: After moving to small-town Arizona and falling for an older widowed pharmacist, a divorcée with a 12-year old son gets an unwanted visit from her ex.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A vacationing couple gets embroiled in a game of cat-and-mouse with Bermuda gangsters after discovering a cache of drugs stashed inside a sunken ship.

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: Feeling responsible for his father's death, which occurred during a climbing expedition, Peter Garrett (Chris O'Donnell) has quit the pursuit in favor of photography, while his sister, Annie (Robin Tunney), has become a top climber. After Annie is hired by wealthy businessman Elliot Vaughn (Bill Paxton) to lead a trek, inclement weather causes the crew to become trapped. Facing his fears, Peter assembles a rescue team, including experienced climber Montgomery Wick (Scott Glenn), to save them.

programme.title: 28 Days
programme.desc: A disastrous drunken episode lands a successful New York journalist in rehab where she encounters a bizarre assortment of characters and rituals.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: After bounty hunter Milo learns that his next target is his ex-wife Nicole, the two become entangled in a contentious web of games.

programme.title: Colombiana
programme.desc: An orphaned girl grows up to become a professional assassin working for her uncle, always hoping to hunt down the mobster behind her parents’ deaths.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Montana, this is the tale of a Colonel and his three sons who compete for the affections of the same young woman.

programme.title: A Dandy in Aspic
programme.desc: In this stylish spy thriller, a Londoner working in British Intelligence, Alexander Eberlin, turns out to be a Russian counter-espionage agent.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again!
programme.desc: In this 1953 musical remake of The Awful Truth, a recently-divorced couple try every way to make each other jealous.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: Doctor Faustus
programme.desc: Frustrated with the limits of his knowledge, Dr. Faustus calls upon Lucifer and offers his soul in return for 24 years of hedonism and invincibility.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: The 7th Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: The heroic mariner must clear all sorts of hurdles in the way of rescuing a princess who’s been miniaturized and held captive by a ruthless magician.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: Pal Joey
programme.desc: Charming musical featuring the love triangle between a lovable but mischievous man and the two women who could change his life, for love or money.

programme.title: A Man for All Seasons
programme.desc: From the Robert Bolt play.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Secret Patrol
programme.desc: A Mountie (Charles Starrett) works under cover to solve the murder of his best friend.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Cowboy Star
programme.desc: A disenchanted movie cowboy proves to be a genuine hero when he's forced to shoot it out with a gang of desperadoes.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up
programme.desc: Kindly, fading star Carol Stevens (Helen Twelvetrees) accepts a role in a two-bit Western movie and arrives for an on-location shoot in a small town. When Stevens has words with her pompous co-star, Grant Drexel (Grant Withers), Drexel's stuntman, Buck Kennedy (Buck Jones), steps in to defend her. Kennedy's honorable gesture costs him his job. After a group of gangsters posing as a film crew frames the newly unemployed Kennedy for the robbery of a local bank, he must struggle to clear his name.

programme.title: Snake River Desperadoes
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) squares off against men who are trying to ignite a war between whites and American Indians.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Renegades
programme.desc: Hannah Brockway (Evelyn Keyes) has a perfect fiancé in Dr. Sam Martin (Willard Parker). Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Riders of the Badlands
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger's uncanny resemblance to a wanted outlaw results in his own arrest by a fellow lawman.

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: Wyoming Renegades
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Phil Carey) and his girlfriend (Martha Hyer) cannot start over until they stop Butch Cassidy's (Gene Evans) gang.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: The Human Comedy
programme.desc: A small-town telegraph boy deals with growing up during World War II.

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: Tortilla Flat
programme.desc: Inhabitants of a California village strive for the simple pleasures.

programme.title: The Hypnotic Eye
programme.desc: A city is stricken by a wave of horrific self-mutilations.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Horror of Dracula
programme.desc: After finding his missing friend undead in Dracula’s crypt, vampire hunter Van Helsing must save his pal’s frail fiancée from the count’s next bite.

programme.title: The Belle of New York
programme.desc: A turn-of-the-century playboy courts a Salvation Army girl.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: The Charge of the Light Brigade
programme.desc: Two brothers love the same woman at a perilous Indian outpost.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: A pair of feuding co-workers at a music shop in turn-of-the-century Chicago have no idea they are falling in love as anonymous romantic pen pals.

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge
programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: The Man Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: After an accident, a literary critic recovers at the home of the family he was visiting, but his unplanned stay turns their lives upside down.

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Boys Town
programme.desc: True story of Father Flanagan's fight to build a home for orphaned boys.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Three Godfathers
programme.desc: Fugitives risk their lives to bring a baby out of the desert to safety.

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.desc: An aspiring singer (Ace Young) is murdered and, as Brennan and Booth investigate the musician's fans and foes, one obsessed woman transfers her affections to Booth.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A teen discovers a dismembered, headless body in a pool of purple water; the team struggles to find enough evidence to locate a killer until getting insight from Zack, who studies the case at his psychiatric facility.

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: Bones

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of Patton's friend, a former Navy SEAL gunned down in a drive-by shooting while Patton watched.

programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant from a well-connected and affluent family has a fatal fall down a flight of stairs at a charity gala; the team investigates whether his death was an accident or foul play.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The Five-0 team learns that one of its own has a deep connection to the young daughter of a woman who was murdered in her home.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and DC Ben Jones (Jason Hughes) find themselves attempting to unravel the deaths of a choir tenor, and later a bird watcher, before more murders occur. The case is complicated by a rivalry between the Midsomer Worthy and Aston Wherry choirs, due to compete in an upcoming competition, and suspicions that an art scam is to be conducted, and soon Barnaby and Jones become concerned about a local woman, who they fear may become a victim herself. Particularly when it becomes clear the bird watcher had been photographing suspicious activity of late.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a survivalist is found murdered in his bombproof shelter, Barnaby unravels a dark conspiracy to reveal how far people will go to escape the end of the world.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Gated estate Challis Court is a tight-knit community for retired police officers, but when a new arrival is found dead, the other residents regard the murder as an affront. Barnaby realizes that the killer is likely an ex-police officer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Elverton-Cum-Latterly battle in the Dominoes Competition that dates back decades, but when the event occurs the same night as a drag queen fundraiser for a terminally ill teenager, it results in a deadly clash of cultures.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Two brothers want to surprise their dad with the ultimate car guy gift.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the Count's Kustoms crew rally together to help Shannon restore his father's long lost chopper. Meanwhile, Danny does a do-over on his customized 1990 Chevy Suburban.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When the World Series of Poker guys want a Count's Kustoms chopper as the ultimate online giveaway, Danny is determined to make it something special.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is so proud of the van he restored as a gift for his bandmate John Zito, that he decides to give his own classic van a make-over.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: An eccentric couple wants to turn a 20 year-old ambulance into a ghost-hunting vehicle, which awakens a rogue spirit in the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin disapproves of how much money Danny is spending tricking out his dream FMC Motorhome, but Danny has a surprise plan to help him get over it.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Rock Legend Alice Cooper left his prized Avanti in The Count's hands, and now, he's back to get it! Will Alice like what Danny and the crew have done?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Scott bugs out when he learns Danny's invested in a vintage dune buggy. Will Danny prove Scott wrong and flip this sand shredder for some serious dough?

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny can't stop buying cars. Soon after striking a deal on Gordon's '73 Mustang, he finds an enormous FMC Motorhome.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When Danny is asked to create a commemorative bike that honors music legend Les Paul he has to pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has wanted a Plymouth Roadrunner ever since a couple of car nuts pulled him over a few years ago, and bought his Sebring on the spot.

programme.desc: Danny and Shannon honor fallen troops with a custom patriotic motorcycle. Later, Danny and Kevin push the limit to acquire a `71 Monte Carlo, and then have a tough decision.

programme.desc: Danny tries to score an ex-police motorcycle without getting busted, while a watermain break threatens to put the shop permanently under water.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out the only 1933 Double Eagle gold coin for sale; Chum visits Disneyland with a miniature model of Main Street USA; Corey hopes for a big bang when he investigates a tiny Japanese matchlock pistol.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller Super Bowl shuffles into the shop with a helmet and football signed by Da Bears; Chum strikes a jumpman pose as he checks out a bronze Michael Jordan statue; Corey says hello to a replica 1963 Cadillac from the movie "Scarface."

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum rack up points testing the merchandise at a pinball paradise; Corey saddles up to a piece of World War II history; Chum sleuths out a sale on a set of Sherlock Holmes books; Rick welcomes Guns N' Roses guitarist, ASHBA.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A model train once owned by Johnny Cash comes into the shop; a 1920's chicken incubator; Rick checks out a 17th century Tibetan Buddha.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller strolls in with a collection of action figures signed by the cast of "The Walking Dead"; Corey is too cool when a "Rock n Roll High School" poster comes into the shop; Chum tries to catch an unusual Pokémon card.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A World War II Morse Code reader enters the shop; Rick negotiates for a letter written by John Quincy Adams; Corey takes over Rick's annual Fourth of July barbecue.

programme.desc: Rick and Chumlee are drawn to an original "Rocky and Bullwinkle Show" sketch; Rick inspects a possible first edition of Richard Nixon's memoirs; Chumlee tries his hand at wheeling and dealing.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase and the guys discover they have a knack for removing pests from other people's property, they use their new talents to their advantage. Meanwhile, Willie gives Sadie and John Luke summer jobs at his diner, but first he must train them to be good employees.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When an office prank war spirals out of control, Phil volunteers Willie, Jase, and Jep to help Alan at the church, which seems more like a punishment than charity work. Meanwhile, Korie gives Kay a surprise art class taught by famous artist Pierre Matisse.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the guys spend the weekend at a hunting cabin to celebrate Martin's bachelor party, things turns explosive after they find a cache of antique black powder weapons. Meanwhile, Willie helps Kay fulfill her lifelong dream of owning a petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Uncle Si has a brush with death, he creates a bucket list and asks the guys to help him fulfill his dreams. Meanwhile, Kay sets out to prove to Willie and Alan that she actually graduated high school.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Duck Commander sponsors a NASCAR race, Jase and the guys get themselves in the mood by attempting to work as a pit crew. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie challenge John Luke and his fianc Mary Kate to a doubles tennis match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: In this very special wedding episode, John Luke Robertson is getting married to his fiancé Mary Kate, and our cameras are with him every step of the way.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Missy's parents visit, her father convinces Jase to take him on a quail hunt. But while their "bonding hunt" yields very few quail, it does bring them closer together as friends.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si recruits his nephews to help him transport a storage container to his backyard, but things take a turn when Jep becomes locked inside the box.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie's old rival Phillip McMillan challenges him to a game of dodgeball, Willie recruits his family members to settle a score once and for all.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and the guys take John Luke golfing prior to his engagement party, their attempts at marital advice don't exactly work out as planned.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Jase receives a palate of fireworks as a gift, he and the guys create a homemade fireworks display for the Robertson family 4th of July barbeque. Meanwhile, Uncle Si is honored by the veterans association and given his own exhibit at a local military museum.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil and Jase get into an argument about which type of duck decoy works best, Jase and the guys repaint some old decoys, betting that Phil cannot tell the difference. Meanwhile, Jessica challenges Willie to a bowling contest with Kay's "Big Sista's" club.
